context_0.vignette: Heinz's wife has recently fallen ill and needs an expensive medication that is not covered by her medical insurance. They do not have the money needed to purchase the expensive prescription medication, but they know that it is vital for her to have it if she is going to recover.
context_0.prompt: One thing that Heinz should do is to
generation: reach out to the pharmaceutical company that makes the medication
seek help from family, friends, or community organizations
look at all possible options to get the medication she needs
seek financial assistance from either local government agencies, charities, or pharmaceutical companies
explore all possible options to finance the medication
contact the pharmaceutical company directly

explore all the potential options available to him such as discussing with his doctor about any alternatives or generic versions of the medication, contacting patient assistance programs that might provide discounted or free medication, setting up a crowdfunding or fundraising campaign, contacting family and friends for help, or seeking advice from a medical social worker on other financial assistance options
seek help from various charities or non-profit organizations that aid in providing needed medications to individuals who cannot afford them
seek help from family, friends, or fundraising platforms to raise the needed amount
reach out to various resources to seek financial assistance

context_1.vignette: Josh is on the way to the airport to catch a flight for a hunting safari in Africa. He leaves with plenty of time to make it there, but his car breaks down on the highway. Now Josh is sitting in his car near a busy intersection, and knows he needs to get to airport soon if he is going to catch his flight.
context_1.prompt: One thing that Josh should do is to
generation: call a taxi service, ride-hailing service like Uber, or a roadside assistance company to either fix his car quickly or get him to the airport
call a taxi, ride-sharing service, or a friend to get him to the airport while arranging for his car to be towed or repaired
call a taxi, Uber, or other ride service to pick him up and take him to the airport
call a taxi, an Uber, or any other transportation service immediately
call a taxi, uber or another car service immediately to take him to the airport
call a taxi, an Uber, or any other instant ride service so he can quickly reach the airport
call for a taxi or a rideshare service such as Uber or Lyft to quickly get to the airport while his car is being repaired or towed
call a roadside assistance service to get his car repaired, and concurrently call a taxi or ride-share service like Uber or Lyft to get him to the airport on time
call for a taxi, Uber, or any other immediate ride service to take him to the airport while he makes arrangements for his car to be towed or repaired later
call a taxi, Uber, or Lyft

context_2.vignette: Brian is the evening manager at a bakery. Near the end of the day, he realizes that $50.75 is missing from the register and that he is responsible for accounting for the money at the end of the day. Brian knows he has to make sure the register is balanced or he might lose his job.
context_2.prompt: One thing that Brian should do is to
generation: immediately notify the store owner or the appropriate superior about the missing money
check all the receipts and transactions of the day to see if there was any miscalculation or mistake
contact his supervisor or the owner of the bakery to report the missing money, while also checking the sales records and CCTV footage (if available) to see if there was a mistake or theft
review the security camera footage and transaction records to find out if there were any mistakes or theft
contact his supervisor or owner to report the missing money
report the missing money to his supervisor or higher authority
carefully recount the money and double-check any receipts or transactions to ensure the total is correct
contact his supervisor or the owner of the bakery and report the discrepancy
immediately inform his superior about the missing money
thoroughly re-check his sales records and receipts, looking for any discrepancies or errors in transactions that might have led to the shortage

context_4.vignette: Mary is about to go to her final class of the day when she remebers that there is a homework assignment that is due. Mary's mom accidentally took her homework assignment out of her backpack when she was making room for her lunch. Now Mary has nothing to turn in for credit.
context_4.prompt: One thing that Mary should do is to
generation: immediately communicate the situation to her teacher and request for an extension
tell her teacher what happened and ask for an extension or if she can turn the homework in later
communicate with her teacher about the situation
immediately inform her teacher about the situation and ask for an extension to submit her homework
immediately explain the situation to her teacher and ask for an extension, showing her completed homework the next day
explain the situation to her teacher honestly, apologize for her mistake, and ask for an extension to submit her homework
immediately contact her teacher and explain the situation
explain the situation to her teacher honestly and ask for any possible solution
explain the situation to her teacher and ask for an extension to submit the assignment
explain the situation to her teacher and ask for an extension so she can turn in the assignment later

context_5.vignette: Brad and some friends are hiking through the mountains in the Canadian wilderness. A couple of days into their hike, Brad realizes that they are lost. He knows that a rescue crew could arrive before long, but it is extremely cold and they don't have much food or water left.
context_5.prompt: One thing that Brad should do is to
generation: stay calm, keep everyone together in one place, and try to construct a shelter to protect from the cold
build a shelter to protect from the cold conditions and ensure his group stays in one location, which will make it easier for a rescue team to find them
stay put and build a shelter to provide protection from the weather conditions
stay in one place and create a visible signal for rescuers
stay put
build a shelter for protection from the elements and to make a fire for warmth
stay put in one location and try to make it as visible as possible from both the ground and the air to help the rescue crew to find them
stay put in one location, preferably a visible one
stay calm and try to keep the group together
stay put where they are if they are in a safe, visible location
